Package database

Class FilmDAO

java.lang.Object
database.FilmDAO
public class FilmDAO extends Object
Java class that uses SQL queries to perform CRUD and search operations on a database.
Author:
Sabiha Patel

  • Method Details

    • openConnection

      private void openConnection()
      Establishes a connection to the MySQL database using JDBC. Attempts to open a connection using login details/parameters to connect to the database.

    • closeConnection

      private void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection.

    • getNextFilm

      private Film getNextFilm(ResultSet rs)
      Gets the next film. Reads the fields from the row in the result set and creates a new Film object
      Parameters:
      rs - resultset from where the film data is received
      Returns:
      the next film

    • getAllFilms

      public ArrayList<Film> getAllFilms()
      Gets all the films Gets films one by one using a ResultSet and adds them to an arraylist
      Returns:
      allFilms all the films in the arraylist

    • insertFilm

      public void insertFilm(Film f) throws SQLException
      Inserts a film into the films table Opens a connection to the database and uses a SQL INSERT prepared statement to create a new film based on the fields.
      Parameters:
      f - the film being added
      Throws:
      SQLException - the SQL exception

    • deleteFilm

      public void deleteFilm(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a film. Opens a connection to the database and uses a SQL DELETE prepared statement to delete a film based on the ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the film being deleted
      Throws:
      SQLException - the SQL exception

    • updateFilm

      public void updateFilm(Film f) throws SQLException
      Updates a film. Opens a connection to the database and uses a SQL UPDATE prepared statement to update a film based on the ID.
      Parameters:
      f - the film being updated
      Throws:
      SQLException - the SQL exception
